verses.text: Would \add to God\add* you could bear with me a little in \add my\add* folly: and indeed bear with me.
For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that \add I\add* may present \add you as\add* a chaste virgin to Christ.
But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or \add if\add* ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with \add him\add*.
For I suppose \add I\add* was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.
But though \add I be\add* rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we \add have been\add* throughly made manifest among you in all \add things\add*.
Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that you might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?
I robbed other churches, taking wages \add of them\add*, to do you service.

And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no \add man:\add* for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all \add things\add* I have kept myself from being burdensome to you, and \add so\add* will I keep \add myself\add*.
\add As\add* the truth of Christ is in me, no \add man\add* shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.
But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.
For such \add are\add* false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.
Therefore \add it is\add* no great \add thing\add* if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.
I say again, Let no \add man\add* think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.
\add That\add* which I speak, I speak \add it\add* not after the Lord, but as \add it were\add* foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye \add yourselves\add* are wise.
For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour \add you\add*, if a man take \add of you\add*, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.
I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.
Are they Hebrews? so \add am\add* I. Are they Israelites? so \add am\add* I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so \add am\add* I.
Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I \add am\add* more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.
Of the Jews five times received I forty \add stripes\add* save one.
Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwrack, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

\add in\add* journeyings often, \add in\add* perils of waters, \add in\add* perils of robbers, \add in\add* perils by \add my own\add* countrymen, \add in\add* perils by the heathen, \add in\add* perils in the city, \add in\add* perils in the wilderness, \add in\add* perils in the sea, \add in\add* perils among false brethren;
in weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.
Besides those \add things\add* that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.
Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?
If I must needs glory, I will glory of the \add things\add* which concern mine infirmities.
The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.
In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes \add with a garrison\add*, desirous to apprehend me:
and through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.
